The representative of the European Commission’s Joint Research Centre, Ciarán Nicholl,
intervened pointing out that a lot of systems, best practices and recommendations are
already in place and that, as the BECA Chair had said, what is needed now is to go ahead
and implement them thoroughly. He mentioned the Cancer Information System (ECIS),
which feeds from 170 cancer registries throughout the EU and will be expanded within the
EBCP and the Mission on Cancer, whereas he also drew attention to the launching of the
“Knowledge Centre for Cancer” in June.
